text: The Jama Masjid, also known as the Masjid-i Jahān-Numā (, which translates as the 'World-reflecting Mosque') is the principal mosque of Old Delhi in India. It was built in 1656 by the Mughals under Emperor Shah Jahan. Category:Mosques in India Category:Mughal architecture Category:1656 establishments Category:17th-century establishments in India Category:17th-century buildings and structures
title: Jama Masjid
